name: Android personal finance management app (Money_tracker)
description: Programmed app using Java, Android SDK that categorizes and visualizes income/spending on different types of graphs
Authenticated users using Firebase, and stored user data in real time
Utilized Python, deep learning concepts, and MLKit for detecting text from bounding boxes in receipts
Extracted strings using Tesseract model from the specified boxes and post-processed using Regex parsers to filter out artifacts

name: Multi-platform travel management app (itimoney)
description: Developed interface using Flutter and Dart for an app that helps track finances while travelling
Parsed the data fetched from CapitalOne API into JSON and visualized the data in a graph using Python
Prototyped the functionalities of app using Figma and designed using Canva

name: Android app for donation (CareBuddy)
description: Launched an android native app that uses pre-built functionalities making the donation process easier for donor and donee
Utilized Java, Android SDK, SQL for data management and Firebase for user authentication and real-time data storage

name: IOS app using custom backend server (Instagram Clone)
description: Utilized Swift, UIKit, Cocoa Touch to make a clone of Instagram with a global photos feed
Implemented Parse and Back4app for a custom-configured backend allowing users to post photos and add comments
Queried Parse for posts, likes, and comments, displaying them in a table view using auto layout

name: Bike Rental Web Application
description: Deployed a web app crafted with Embedded Ruby templates, CSS, and JavaScript for the front-end, and Ruby on Rails MVC framework with MySQL database for the back-end, hosted on Heroku
Integrated Google Maps API for interactive map and station locator and Devise & Omniauth for (third-party) authentication

Delivered key features including streamlined rental process, searchable FAQ page, profile page with rental history, Google Translate for multi-language support, and service request option to enhance user experience
Managed the project through Agile methodology and Scrum, leading to continuous improvements and successful iterations

name: Spotify Social web application
description: Engineered a single-page application with React.js, designing dynamic components to render user-specific data, such as top songs and artists, fetched directly from the Spotify API
Leveraged Express.js in constructing a backend infrastructure, managing API and database interactions initiated by user requests from the React frontend, ensuring seamless client-server communication

Deployed Firebase for real-time data storage and retrieval, facilitating essential features such as user profile management, interactive social forums, and the ability to query for specific forums by name
